file_content.text: Congratulations. You're inside. Did you give any thought to what might happen next?
Coronet Shipping is under my command. You may have beaten our defenses, but you won't get past my men.
Your numbers against ours make the odds pretty even.
They can't beat us.
I think not. One Imperial is worth a hundred Republic.
You've lost, Captain Granta. Disable the neutron emitters.
It's over for you.
Do you really think it would make a difference if I did?
I left a trail of your men behind me. It would be wise to surrender.
Someone's in denial.
If I allowed survivors, I might tell you the same thing.
I don't want to kill more of your men, but I will if I have to.
Stand down, Captain.
Those men were expendable.
Might want to ask all the troops I just passed about that.
But I already have.
You'll find the men who guard the tunnels very different from the men who guard me.
I've beaten shock troops all over Corellia. How are these men any different?
You sure about that?
They were hand-picked by their commander. And he'll be leading them against you.
You'll die with them unless you get out of my way.
Don't give me orders.
Outside, the tunnels were your escape route. In here, you have nowhere to run.
Destroying the neutron emitters will get you nowhere. We have other ways of keeping the Republic under control.
No matter how many tricks the Empire pulls, I'll stop them.
Your ways won't work.
You will be another pile of corpses, nothing more.
You will be another corpse, nothing more.
That's a little cryptic.
What does that mean?
The Republic prefers a fair fight. I prefer a fight I can win.
You asked for it. [Attack]
Orders, sir?
Show the Republic how the Empire handles its enemies.
Corellia belongs to the Empire. The Republic's wasting its time.
